active_contexts.statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export orders notably weak.
active_contexts.market_link: EU manufacturing contraction can weigh global risk tone and support duration demand; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).

active_contexts.statement: NY Fed standing repo facility usage spiked to a reported record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs.
active_contexts.market_link: Highlights calendar-driven front-end funding tightness; watch whether usage normalizes post-turn for rates/liquidity tone.
active_contexts.notes: Short TTL: year-end effect; monitor normalization.

active_contexts.statement: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% in Nov (Oct 2.8%); loans to HH 2.9%, to NFCs 3.1%.
active_contexts.market_link: Slow-moving liquidity signal for EUR rates/FX; usually secondary for US index futures absent broader EU risk shocks.

watchlist.statement: US cash close (Jan 2): MOC buy imbalance S&P +1485.3M; NQ +330.8M; Dow +432.2M; Mag7 +273.3M.
watchlist.market_link: Large closing imbalances can create late-day futures dislocations and raise next-session gap sensitivity in ES/NQ.

watchlist.statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; in line with forecast and prior.
watchlist.market_link: Low surprise content vs ISM; more sensitivity to prices/new orders subcomponents than headline confirmation.

watchlist.statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 vs flash 51.2; marginal expansion but softer than first read.
watchlist.market_link: UK/Europe growth tone can influence broad risk sentiment; usually modest direct impact on US index futures.

watchlist.statement: Market attention on potential Fed leadership changes ahead of Chair Powell term end (May 2026) and nomination talk.
watchlist.market_link: Fed independence/leadership headlines can move front-end rates, term premium, and USD risk premia; sensitivity is episodic.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Reaction-function framing can move front-end pricing and spill into equity duration sensitivity (ES/NQ) and USD (DX).

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: A second appearance can reinforce/clarify prior remarks; focus on inflation vs growth balance and conditions for policy shifts.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Meeting (Decision/Statement; press conference 2:30pm ET)
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Scheduled policy decision; reprices front-end expectations and can transmit to equity multiples and USD via real-rate moves.

change_log.reason: Kept Dec final PMI context; Reuters Jan 2, 2026 reiterated Germany 47.0 and export-sales weakness.
Confirmed Nov 2025 M3 3.0% y/y and lending details from ECB release dated Jan 2, 2026.
Confirmed Jan 27-28, 2026 meeting dates and standard 2:00pm ET statement/2:30pm ET presser timing via Fed calendar/press release.
